Name: Magic: The Gathering – Core Set 2020 Spellslinger Starter Kit
Description:
The Spellslinger Starter Kit is a learn-to-play product aimed at new players, including instructional materials that guide two players through their first game. It was sold in local game stores and mass market stores.

Unlike its previous installment (which was released on the same day as Guilds of Ravnica, but had no obvious connection to that set), this Starter Kit is marketed as part of the Core Set 2020 release. They are now mono-color decks, and the two face cards are given the foil treatment.

Contents

2 60-card preconstructed decks, each containing 5 rares.[3]
2 Two quick-start guides
1 Rules and world-of-Magic booklet
2 “do no shuffle”/"on your turn" cards
2 Spindown life counters
1 MTG Arena code card

Name: Pandora Cat
Description:
In Pandora Cat, a.k.a. ãƒ‘ãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒ©ã®çŒ«, you're racing to reach a points threshold before any other player can, but in each round you never know whether you want to score high or low until it's almost over.

Each round, each player is dealt four cards from the 24-card deck. Each of the eight types of cards has a value on it as well as a special ability. Each player chooses one card from their hand, then they reveal these cards in clockwise order from the starting player. Players then do this again two more times, leaving them with one card in hand.

Your score for the round is the sum of the value of the card in your hand and the value of the cards you played. Normally the player with the highest score earns 5 points, with the players in second and third earning 3 and 1 points respectively — but if a player has played two "Pandora Cat" cards, then the player with the lowest score earns 5 points! If two players have each played two "Pandora Cat" cards, then scoring is normal, whereas three players having done this reverses the score once again.

Rotate the start player position each round, and complete multiple rounds until a player has scored at least 12, 14, or 16 points in a three-player, four-player, or five- or six-player game.

Name: Wieczna Waśń
Description:
Wieczna WaÅ›Å„ ("Eternal Feud") is a strategic board game from 2 to 4 people / 8 + / 60-120 depending on the map of the land, in which 4 feuded races fight for dominance in a randomly created land.

No one remembers how the feud began, who came to the field or who first chewed on the stone ... the fact is that this feud seems to have always happened. People against the green horde of orcs from the north ... until one day the conflict joined the fallen, a great army of the dead rose up and went to war with the living ... in this eternal feud.

—description from the designer

Name: Dungeon Bounty
Description:
"The once profitable mines of Altair have become overrun with the most sinister of beasts. Miners, knights, and sell-swords have all fallen at the claws of these foul creatures. With the Kingdom of Yule already on the verge of bankruptcy, the King cannot afford to lose control of these mines. No amount of death can stop his desire to retain his power.Lucky for you, your reputation as a Bounty Hunter has earned you a chance to prove your worth. Capturing criminals has been easy, surely your unique skill set will transfer to killing beasts. The King is willing to empty the last of the kingdom's coffers for the heads of these creatures. Will you fall amongst the treasure and corpses of the cavern or slay your enemies to claim your due glory?"

Dungeon Bounty is a fast paced hand management game designed to be played with a single standard deck of playing cards. On each turn, players flip two cards from the deck (dungeon). If the cards are a 1-10 of clubs (weapons), diamonds (gemstones), or spades (spells), the player chooses one to add to their play area. Face cards (Jacks, Queens, and Kings) are the bounties, the creatures you are hunting, and when they pop up as one of the two drawn cards from the dungeon, you need to defeat them using your attack power from weapons and spells. The more bounties you collect, the higher your score.

If you are unable to defeat a monster, they do damage to you, reducing your strength, which is represented by the 1-10 of hearts. If you are at 1 strength and are damaged by an enemy, you lose. If you manage to stay alive, the game ends after two trips through the dungeon. After you've depleted the deck the first time, you shuffle the discard pile and play through the deck a second time. Compare your score to the scoring guide and see your destiny.

—description from the publisher

Name: Cruel Seas: AB-Tei Gunboat
Description:
The Imperial Japanese Army started developing small gunboats for close support of amphibious landings in 1924 and by 1927 had the AB-Tei gunboat. By WWII these would be diesel-powered.  They would be transported to the landing zones on merchant ships. They were also used as patrol boats in rivers, harbors and coastal zones and to escort supply barges. In this role they encountered PT boats.

The ‘57 mm’ guns were actually the Japanese Type 97 47 mm anti-tank gun or a British 6 pdr.  Contains 4 gunboats and state cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pirates & Lasers
Description:
Pirates & Lasers is a strategic struggle between ghost pirates and incompetent laser-wielding tourists. Keep the ship sailing as long as you can while lasers tear your ship asunder, managing resources and preventing damage to critical areas.

This turn-based strategy game challenges players to survive laser attacks and repair the boat hull each turn to prevent sinking.

Ship Blinks, which have health and the ability to transfer health to any neighboring Ship Blink, and Hazard Blinks, which fire lasers out in three directions, damaging any part of the Ship in its path. A turn has three stages - Rearrange, Repair, and Lasers! During Rearrange, Ship and Hazard Blinks are moved to prevent damage. During Repair, resources can be moved from one part of the Ship to another. During Lasers!, the Hazard Blinks fire off their lasers, dealing damage to any part of the Ship in its path. The game ends when any part of the Ship hits zero health. See how many turns you can survive in a given scenario!

-description from publisher

Name: Pizza Delivery
Description:
In Pizza Delivery, you are a pizza delivery courier, and you must try to make the most profit out of one delivery day, both by delivering pizzas and by fulfilling your secret objectives. You can also use money to buy extra equipment if you think that will help you in the long run.

Whoever has the most money at the end of the game wins.

Name: Ferien-Rallye
Description:
Each player moves his car by roll of a die on a map of the Weserbergland, a region in Northern Germany. Each player starts at Hannover and draws 3 destination cards. When a player arrives at one of his destinations, he must stop, discards his card and draws an event card. The player who first stopped at all 3 destinations and returned to Hannover wins the game.
This game is part of a serie concerning several regions.

—user summary

Name: KAOS
Description:
KAOS is a battle game where two sides of twenty fighters will have to defeat each other in order for the wish of their God Etharyl to be fulfilled. In KAOS each player represents an Etharyl, who will declare a wish before battle.

The player (an Etharyl God), before combat, can make sacrifices in his own team to resurrect fighters or make them more powerful, managing his team in order to avoid running out fighters. Also, the player can erase skills from rival fighters by exhausting glint points, in a limited way. During combat between fighters, destiny will decide.

The game is finished when an Etharyl runs out of fighters. At this moment, it must accept the wish of the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: Tattered Tales
Description:
Tattered Tales is a game that requires players to compete as teams to create stories using a collection of random items to solve a problem.

To play a round, players will split into teams and each team is dealt five item cards.  A single situation card is revealed for all teams.  Players have two minutes to work together in teams to create a story that uses the items to resolve the situation.

Once the time is up, teams take turns telling their stories to the rest of the players.  Everybody votes on which story they liked the best (besides their own) and a new round begins with new teams.

After a few rounds, final scoring is calculated and a single player is given the title of Master Storyteller.

Name: The Once and Future Cuisine
Description:
It’s the Time Tyrant’s wedding and they’ve called on you to whip up the feast! The Tyrant knows a chef is only
as good as their ingredients and has loaned you a time machine to let you leap through the ages and collect delicacies that will truly wow the guests.

Each round has three phases: 1) travel in time, 2) claim ingredients, 3) cleanup. Starting with the first player and proceeding clockwise, each player on their turn places a pawn on an era board, representing their claim on an ingredient from that era. Then, after everyone has placed their pawns, all chefs collect their ingredients, and the era boards are refilled.

Chefs are looking to show off their skills by featuring either a course of the same dish type (drink, appetizer, entree, or dessert) but of different eras known as a "Dish Set", or showcase the foods of one era known as an "Era Set".

The game ends immediately when either of the following happens during the “refill” step of the round’s Cleanup phase: either  3 or more era boards have all their cuisine spots filled with cards from eras other than their own (Paradoxes Aplenty), or it is not possible to fill all the cuisine spots on 1 or more era boards (Continuity Error). The chef with the tastiest tableau is the winner.

-description from publisher

Name: Arena: The Contest – Legendary Box
Description: The Legendary Box contains all stretch goals from the initial Kickstarter campaign for Arena: The Contest (Imperial Box) as well as all expansions from the first campaign (Heroes & Dungeons, Harun the Shapeshifter, Hydra, Ascaran the Archangel & Vanarus the Demon, and The Elder Dragon).

Name: Canvas: Kickstarter Mini Expansion
Description:
Kickstarter exclusive that includes 10 art cards and 8 award cards (plus a rules cards).

The art cards in the mini expansion feature two new icons that are not in the base game. The bonus ribbon gives you straight victory points, but doesn't help you meet any scoring conditions. The x2 icon doubles the icon in the slot that it points to.

Each game you can play with a different Award card that has a unique game end scoring rule. These cards add variability and complexity to make the game more replayable, especially at expert levels.

Card art descriptions:
"…Desires" (human teeth with rainbow gums at top and bottom)
"…Dread" (curly, leafless blue tree on the right)
"Scorched…" (purple/blue dragon in the upper left)
"…Expression" (street artist kneeling on the right spraying red into the center)
"Forgotten…" (unstable and overgrown tower ruin on the left)
"Simple…" (red, yellow, and blue paper airplanes at the top)
"…Imagination" (person riding unicorn with green wings in the upper right)
"Secret…" (open treasure chest in lower left with glowing blue contents)
"…Mirage" (an orange/purple rock formation seems to be starting to levitate)
"Pointless…" (green, red, and purple fireworks in the center)

Name: Tlamatini
Description: A trivia game about Mexico. The board consists of a map of Mexico, with a route leading from the Northwest to the Southeast. The active player rolls a d6 which determines a trivia category, then has to answer a question in that category. If successful, they move forward; if wrong, others get a chance to answer the question. Movement range is decided by whether additional clues were used. Some fields also have special functions. The first player to arrive at the end of the route is the winner.

Name: Sagrada: 2020 Promo Pack
Description:
Make your collection complete with all the Sagrada promos released through the beginning of 2020! This pack contains the promos we've given at conventions, through reviewer partners, one released in Poland only and a promo exclusive to this pack!

Promo pack Includes Window Pattern Cards:

     2020 Promo Pack Exclusive (on back of Title card)
     Balboa Bay / Vitraux
     Komorebi / Alpenglow
     International Tabletop Day 2018
     Board Game Geek
     Watch It Played
     Man Versus Meeple
     Game Boy Geek
     Apollo / Godfather (previously a Polish-only release)
     Sagrada: Passion - Horizontal Symmetry objective


–description from the publisher
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

Name: Karty Dżentelmenów: Epizod Czwarty
Description:
Inspired by Cards Against Humanity (and with their blessing) comes Karty DÅ¼entelmenów ("Gentlemen Cards"). This is a polish spin-off of CAH and the cards are dual language (Polish and English).

Episode 4 consists of 220 new cards:
50 new Black Cards of questions
155 new White Cards of answers
15 blank cards (5 black, 10 white) for Your ideas.
This game is fully compatible with previous editions

—user summary

Oto dÅ‚ugo wyczekiwany Epizod Czwarty!
PocaÅ‚uj prababciÄ™ w czoÅ‚o i wyÅ‚Ä…cz aparaturÄ™ podtrzymujÄ…cÄ… Å¼ycie! :)
PudeÅ‚ko zawiera 220 kart w tym:
50 nowych Czarnych Kart pytaÅ„ 
155 nowych BiaÅ‚ych Kart odpowiedzi
15 pustych (5 Czarnych i 10 BiaÅ‚ych) kart
na Twoje pomysÅ‚y
PeÅ‚na kompatybilnoÅ›Ä‡ z pozostaÅ‚ymi czÄ™Å›ciami

—description from the publisher

Name: El Rebaño
Description:
El Rebaño is not a usual card game... You’ll have to go around the table while bleating like a sheep, howl out loud while the rest of the players hide or be the shepherd that calls out the flock, so all the sheep go running towards him… It sounds crazy, right?

The aim of the game is to get rid of your cards. You play a card from your stack in the center of the table and then the turn will follow depending on the card played: Is it a coloured sheep card? The player with that colour will play the next card. Is it a special card like the wolf, the shepherd or the dog? The players will have to perform the action... It might even get dark and nobody will know which colour is for a while! Stay alert in the pen, don’t make any mistake, or you’ll get all the cards from the center of the table!

El Rebaño is an active, fast reaction card game for the whole flock at home!


El Rebaño no es un juego de cartas como los demás... ¿En qué juego tienes que dar vueltas a una mesa balando como una oveja? ¿O dar un largo aullido mientras los demás se esconden? ¿O que tenga turnos salteados? Por no decir que tienes que hacer de pastor, irte de la mesa y llamar al resto de las ovejas para que acudan corriendo hacia ti. ¿Te parecen suficientes razones para probar "El Rebaño"?

Cada jugador tendrá que deshacerse de su montón de cartas de la mano antes que los demás. Las cartas se juegan de una en una sobre la mesa, pero los turnos van saltando, ya que el siguiente jugador en jugar una carta será el jugador que sea del color de la oveja jugada. Pero a veces en vez de ovejas salen perros pastores (que inician duelos), lobos (que aullan), flores (para comérselas), el rpopio pastor (que llama al rebaño yéndose de la mesa de juego) y hasta se hace de noche (no sabiendo durante un rato que color eres). El primer jugador en quedarse sin cartas ganará la partida.
Families: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)
